TextEquiv.Unicode: to alledge the exaple of David in de
fence of their naughtinesse. Our Sa
viour did not come into the world to be
a Judge but a Saviour, neither did hee
in any place usurp and take to himselfe
the right of the sword. Who therefore
wil make any marveile at it, to see the
adultresse not condemned by him, to be
stoned to death? yet hee sayde: Hath
no man condemned thee? as if hee
minded not to have resisted the lawe, if
judgement had once passed uppon her.
For he came not to be a patrone to ad
ulterers, not to breake the lawe, but
to fulfille it. But if it like adulterers
wel, that the adulteresse was not con
demned of the Lord, then let them also
like that sentence, wherwith the Hy
storie is ended, when the Lorde saith:
Goe thy waies and sinne no more.
Let them therefore leave off the defile
& destroy themselves with filthy ad
dulerie.
The Lord in his law hath expresse
lye named adulterie alone, but there
withal he doth inclusively understand
all kindes of lust and luxurie, and all
things else which do egge forward and
stirre up fire in men to wantonnesse,
which he forbiddeth as severely as ad
ulterie it selfe. The Lorde in the Gos
pell doth not onely forbid the outward
work of adulterie, but the very affecti
on also and wanton lust of the hearte
and minde. Yee have heard (saith he)
that it was said to them of olde, Thou
shalt not commit adulterie. But I say
unto you, that whosoever looketh on
a woman to lust after her, hath com
mitted adulterie alreadie with her in
his heart.
In the same place he teacheth us to
plucke out our eyes, and cut off our
handes, that is, to extinguish unclean
affectios that rise in our minds, while
yet they be young and beginne to bud,

to alledge the exaple of David in de fence of their naughtinesse. Our Sa viour did not come into the world to be a Judge but a Saviour, neither did hee in any place usurp and take to himselfe the right of the sword. Who therefore wil make any marveile at it, to see the adultresse not condemned by him, to be stoned to death? yet hee sayde: Hath no man condemned thee? as if hee minded not to have resisted the lawe, if judgement had once passed uppon her. For he came not to be a patrone to ad ulterers, not to breake the lawe, but to fulfille it. But if it like adulterers wel, that the adulteresse was not con demned of the Lord, then let them also like that sentence, wherwith the Hy storie is ended, when the Lorde saith: Goe thy waies and sinne no more. Let them therefore leave off the defile & destroy themselves with filthy ad dulerie. The Lord in his law hath expresse lye named adulterie alone, but there withal he doth inclusively understand all kindes of lust and luxurie, and all things else which do egge forward and stirre up fire in men to wantonnesse, which he forbiddeth as severely as ad ulterie it selfe. The Lorde in the Gos pell doth not onely forbid the outward work of adulterie, but the very affecti on also and wanton lust of the hearte and minde. Yee have heard (saith he) that it was said to them of olde, Thou shalt not commit adulterie. But I say unto you, that whosoever looketh on a woman to lust after her, hath com mitted adulterie alreadie with her in his heart. In the same place he teacheth us to plucke out our eyes, and cut off our handes, that is, to extinguish unclean affectios that rise in our minds, while yet they be young and beginne to bud,
leaft yer adventure they break out fro
thougthts to deeds.
So then in this Precept every un
cleane thought, al ribaulde talke, and
filthinesse of bodily deedes are utterly
forbidden.
In this precept is forbidden fornica
tion or that kinde of whorehunting,
which is saide to bee the medling of a
single man with an unmarried woma.
This kind of whoredom is thought of
many, either to be a very small offence
or none at all. But such kinde of men
doth the Divel hearte on, bewitch, and
by those ill thoughtes drive on to com
mit that sinne, when as the doctrine of
the Evangelists & Apostles doth teach
us the contrarie. For the Apostles in
that Synodal Epistle, which they sent
from Hierusalem to all nations, do ex
pressely name and forbid fornication.
Saint Peter reckoneth fornication a
mong those filthie sinnes, from which
he would have Christians to bee most
cleare.
Saint Paul saith: Flie fornication.
Again, Let us not be defiled with for
nication, as some of them commit
ted fornication, and fell in one daye
three and twentie thousand. Forni
cation doth directly fight with the co
venant of God, whereby hee is joyned
to us, and wee to him: and whoredom
also spoileth God of his glory, and doth
most filthily pollute the Temple of the
Lorde. Let us heare what the Apo
stle Paul saith touching this matter.
Knowe yee not that your bodies are
the members of Christ? Shal I there
fore take the members of Christ, &
make them the members of an har
lot? God forbidde. What, knowe
yee not that hee that is coupled to an
harlot is one bodie? For two (saieth
hee) shall bee one fleshe. But hee
that is coupled to the Lorde is one

leaft yer adventure they break out fro thougthts to deeds. So then in this Precept every un cleane thought, al ribaulde talke, and filthinesse of bodily deedes are utterly forbidden. In this precept is forbidden fornica tion or that kinde of whorehunting, which is saide to bee the medling of a single man with an unmarried woma. This kind of whoredom is thought of many, either to be a very small offence or none at all. But such kinde of men doth the Divel hearte on, bewitch, and by those ill thoughtes drive on to com mit that sinne, when as the doctrine of the Evangelists & Apostles doth teach us the contrarie. For the Apostles in that Synodal Epistle, which they sent from Hierusalem to all nations, do ex pressely name and forbid fornication. Saint Peter reckoneth fornication a mong those filthie sinnes, from which he would have Christians to bee most cleare. Saint Paul saith: Flie fornication. Again, Let us not be defiled with for nication, as some of them commit ted fornication, and fell in one daye three and twentie thousand. Forni cation doth directly fight with the co venant of God, whereby hee is joyned to us, and wee to him: and whoredom also spoileth God of his glory, and doth most filthily pollute the Temple of the Lorde. Let us heare what the Apo stle Paul saith touching this matter. Knowe yee not that your bodies are the members of Christ? Shal I there fore take the members of Christ, & make them the members of an har lot? God forbidde. What, knowe yee not that hee that is coupled to an harlot is one bodie? For two (saieth hee) shall bee one fleshe. But hee that is coupled to the Lorde is one
